definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
Vanke, large Chinese real estate company, founded in 1984
over ten thousand/fig. untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
Long live (the king, the revolution etc)!/Your Majesty/His Majesty
Wanzhou suburbs of north Chongqing municipality, formerly in Sichuan
Wanli township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan

sentences.english: Closed laser intensity Langevin equation is got.
sentences.chinese: 得到封闭的光强朗之万方程。

sentences.english: The Beijing South Railway Station sees around fifty thousand passengers departing every day.
sentences.chinese: 北京南站每天有将近5万客流量。

sentences.english: May Amma Bhagavan's blessing bring love and joy into your Relationships.
sentences.chinese: 愿阿妈和巴格万的祝福把爱和喜悦带入你的关系之中。

sentences.english: The official death toll has also risen, to 110, 000 people.
sentences.chinese: 官方报道的死亡人口数字也已经上升到11万。

sentences.english: That fire destroyed 38,000 acres and 21 homes.
sentences.chinese: 火火灾造成了3万8千英亩土地和21户住宅的损失。

sentences.english: The company's production from the 22 producing concessions last year totaled over 51, 000 barrels of oil equivalent per day.
sentences.chinese: 公司去年22个产区平均每天产5万一千桶石油。

sentences.english: On average throughout all the quarter-million responses, minds were wandering 47 percent of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在25万回应中，平均下来思绪47%的时间在游荡。

sentences.english: There are already 1.96 million university students in Britain and 1.2 million higher education students, according to the Department for Innovation, Universities and Skills.
sentences.chinese: 在英国，现在有196万大学生和120万研究生。

sentences.english: There are already 1.96 million university students in Britain and 1.2 million higher education students, according to the Department for Innovation, Universities and Skills.
sentences.chinese: 在英国，现在有196万大学生和120万研究生。

sentences.english: Army now has 40,000 soldiers in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 美军目前在德国驻有4万兵力。

sentences.english: In 2015, nearly 400,000 oversea students swarmed into the Chinese market.
sentences.chinese: 2015年，近40万国际学生蜂拥来到中国市场。

sentences.english: Beijing West Station is expecting 5.6 million passengers during this Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 北京西站预计春运期间将有560万乘客。

sentences.english: Westpac Bank has recovered all but NZ$3.8 million.
sentences.chinese: 西太平洋银行仅挽回了380万新西兰元的损失。

sentences.english: A network consisting of about 300,000 surveillance cameras covers the entire capital.
sentences.chinese: 30万摄像头组成的监控网络覆盖整座城市。

sentences.english: BlackBerry has forty-six million users worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 黑莓手机在全球有4600万用户。

sentences.english: Zurvan is mentioned in the Origins of Alchemy Shamanic &Esoteric.
sentences.chinese: 祖以万在萨满教和深奥的炼金术起源中被提到。

definition: surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
sale price/negotiated price/price reached in an auction
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
initial price (e.g. for the first kilometer)/prices starting from
to value/to appraise/to be valued at/estimate/valuation
to convert into/to amount to/to be equivalent to
